column4: !gpg > hendrixski, please read the private message from ubotu
so the email signing thing only works if I send it to someone else who has the same email signing thing set up?
no, I think if they have PGP, they will be able to verify your GPG signature, too. (But I haven't tried)
ah.  Ok.  cool.  well thanks again
what's the error? Use a pastebin please.
I've googled the error that's not what I need... is there a way to purge all of my un-needed packages?
sure, you can feed multiple package names as arguments to 'sudo apt-get --purge remove'
yep, tried that not working though.... is there a way to purge all of the ones that aren't needed?
what do you mean by "aren't needed"? Do you mean packages that have no reverse dependencies?
if that's the issue, deborphan may come in handy
I think that after I've removed a package before it told me that to uninstall all of the no-longer-needed files there was some command
yup that was the one I was thinking of... but that didn't work either... crap
:-) but that autoremove gave me a different error message which gives me more google results :-)
with bash rather than sed, 'tac filename | head -n 2 | tail -n 1' :)
the tac | head | tail thing only prints out the last few lines... is there a way I can then add a line of my own text just before the last line?
